section.name: Introduction
section.p:
jDTAUS Banking provides a common application programming interface to payment system specifications based on
jDTAUS Core. It is split into various artifacts providing flexible integration facilities. The Banking API artifact provides interfaces to various payment system specifications. Although not targeted solely on the german national payment system, currently most of the types are implementing concepts of it. The
Banking Utilities artifact provides banking utility implementations which may be used together with the Banking API artifact if desired.

As with all jDTAUS API artifacts the corresponding application runtime needs to be assembled manually. Whenever the Banking API artifact is used at compile time (whether pulled in transitively or requested), the application assembler needs to provide additional runtime artifacts (see below) for proper operation.

subsection.name: Currency Directory
subsection.p:
The Currency Directory artifact provides the jDTAUS CurrencyDirectory
reference implementation which is backed by classpath XML resources holding the runtime currency instances.

subsection.name: Textschlüssel Verzeichnis
subsection.p:
The Textschluessel Verzeichnis artifact provides the jDTAUS TextschluesselVerzeichnis
reference implementation which is backed by classpath XML resources holding the runtime Textschlüssel instances.

subsection.name: Bankleitzahlen Verzeichnis
subsection.p:
The Bankleitzahlen Verzeichnis artifact provides the jDTAUS BankleitzahlenVerzeichnis
reference implementation backed by Bundesbank bankfiles.

subsection.name: DTAUS
subsection.p: The DTAUS artifact provides the jDTAUS DTAUS reference implementation.

subsection.name: Implementation programming interfaces
subsection.p: The Banking SPI artifact provides interfaces to be used by banking implementations to interface with applications. The above runtime artifacts all share the Banking SPI artifact at compile time so that it will almost ever be pulled in transitively during application assembly.

subsection.name: Maven 2 Repository
subsection.p: As of April, 2007 all jDTAUS artifacts are provided via the central Maven 2 repository in group org.jdtaus. No special configuration is needed any more.
